website_summaries.verdict: This play set is packed with quality components, action-packed design, and endless configuration options.The ultimate marble run set.

customer_reviews.title: Kept Falling Apart
customer_reviews.text: I had serious problems with some parts of this set staying connected. Often as I was trying to add on a new part, one or more of the other parts would become disconnected - usually falling off. It was dependent on what color connector I was inserting into what other color. For me, blue, purple and green connectors worked well together, but when inserted to red or yellow, they would fall out at the slightest touch. This frustrated me, and I would think it would drive children into a rage. I ended up returning this product and getting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Copter

customer_reviews.title: Watch it in action!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Marble Run Set. We looked at sooo many marble run sets. Marble Genius is awesome! Here's what I built with my 3 year old. He also did the filming! (Note: Our design is a little insane, so marbles flying off the set are a result the crazy design and excessive quantity of marbles on the bonus "Swing" pieces, not a product flaw.) Note: This is TWO "Super Sets" combined. Either half of it shows 90% of a Super Set. One is more than enough, but we got two anyway. : )
customer_reviews.author: Ginger benckert

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected! Kids love it!
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to purchase this because of other reviewers mentioning frustration due to loose connections, but I'm happy to report we haven't had that issue. I chose this because it's transparant, which is extra fun watching the marbles go down. We've only had it for a week, but have already built a few different designs. I decided not to take the instructions out of the box to avoid frustration, so the kids just build their own structures with dad's help. Wish it came with a drawstring baggy for the beads and another to contain all the pieces. And I wish it came in clear and/or neon and/or pastel colors as well. I'm so over primary colors.
customer_reviews.author: Funny Face

customer_reviews.title: What perfect gift.
customer_reviews.text: y almost 5 year old grandson requested this for his fifth birthday. He was so excited to receive it and couldn't wait to put it together. He spent 2 ours in his room (which is most unusual for this active child) putting the pieces together. He loves playing with the marble run and it has entertained him for days. What perfect gift.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia S. Wolbe

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for creative and experimental learning.  Fun for the entire family together!!!
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old son started with the Starter set. We really enjoyed it but wanted more as the entire family 8 & 9 year old girls and ageless dad (I totally use this when the kids aren't home) also couldn't get enough. So we ordered the Super Set, Booster set, and a Chain Lift. Much enjoyment has ensued. All anyone wants to do is build runs whenever they are home and have the opportunity. Fantastic "toy" for learning through experimentation and creativity. Also there was an issue with one piece of the Booster set not working well and the seller's president replaced the entire set overnight. Fantastic customer service. Literally can't wait to buy more.
customer_reviews.author: Leporello

customer_reviews.title: but feel strongly enough about how terrible this product is that I had to
customer_reviews.text: I've never written a review here before, but feel strongly enough about how terrible this product is that I had to. So flimsy and fell apart at the slightest touch. It was a Christmas present that didn't even make it through the morning. Do not waste your money on this!
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: Very flimsy.  Nothing like sets from my childhood
customer_reviews.text: I was able to enjoy this set for a short while with my 3 year old despite it's constant wobbling, toppling, and stuck marbles. I'm super disappointed that it is not going to bring the endless fun that I expected. It's just too frustrating! Nothing like the Marbleworks set I had when I was a kid. Even when building the examples from the instructions, some features just swing about with the momentum of the marbles. Pieces are not able to build up any speed! I may convert to another brand if I can find one... We'd have much more fun with a set that can stand up straight for more than 15 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Ross H

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Set
customer_reviews.text: This set is everything we could have hoped for in a marble run set. It's so fun for everyone. We play with it for hours and ended up buying additional accessory kits to go with it. We should have just bought two of these. They go together pretty easily but are extremely sturdy! Won't fall apart at a touch or a bump. My 6 year old can easily make a track on her own. Worth every penny and completely addictive. I think I like it most.
customer_reviews.author: dalexbrd

customer_reviews.title: this is a good starter set with lots of differently amusing pieces
customer_reviews.text: I wish the pieces would fit more snugly together. When putting together more complicated arrangements, the pieces come apart without the weight perfectly balanced. It gets frustrating, especially for a small child. Otherwise, this is a good starter set with lots of differently amusing pieces. I like the transparent tubes (one of the reasons I chose this particular product.)
customer_reviews.author: butterfly

customer_reviews.title: Pieces are too loose and unstable
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my boys for Christmas. It’s a hit for them. It has lots of fun options and I like how many pieces come with it. The app is also a nice addition. However I can confirm that the pieces are rather poorly fitted. Not only do they come apart too easily if touched they loosen just with use of the marbles after a while. Very frustrating to have marbles randomly pop out during play and scramble to god knows where. I would return this if my kids did not enjoy it so much but the quality leaves much to be desired. I’m not confident this will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: TruthfullySpeaking

customer_reviews.title: Addicting, Creative, & stays together very well
customer_reviews.text: 4 yr old twins love it! I wish they would include more "base" pieces.. but that's just my newly skilled marble run architect opinion . Also (as stated in previous reviews) the spinny wheel on the horizontal pieces does not work... the marbles just get stuck.. The little wheel can be removed, but that's just kind of lame.... please fix
customer_reviews.author: lindsy wojtasczyk

customer_reviews.title: HARD TO PUT TOGETHER
customer_reviews.text: I really really wanted to love this. This was my 4 year old sons "Big Gift" for Christmas. It's seriously has taken us hours to put it together. The instructions That are just pictures and leave huge gaps in how to put us together. We decided to turn to Youtube and even a "piece by 'piece" slow motion how to got confusion. I'm really bummed. I wish this would be fun but it's been so confusing trying to get it together.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Could be better but worth it
customer_reviews.text: Love this for my 4 years old and my 1 year loves putting the marbles and watching it make its way through the run. The pieces can be more sturdy and you and kids get frustrated when you have to build and rebuild...but it still is good. Love the endless combinations that you can make without having to go by the book. I now know why there’s so many marbles - easy to get lost. Update: after a month of using this the piece are not connecting well. They’re very loose and fall so easily. Reducing the rate down because it doesn’t last as long as I expected
customer_reviews.author: PD

customer_reviews.title: Good Value, and Highly Entertaining!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Super Set, the Starter Set, and several sets of accessories, for myself. Yes, I'm an adult. Yes, this thing is fun! Everything in this set works as described. I haven't had any trouble with the tracks staying connected. I doubt a very young child could assemble the pieces (they're pretty stiff, plus they have to be correctly oriented), but with an older child's or an adult's help and supervision, it would be loads of fun for a "kid" of any age. You get quite a large assortment of parts, making it a good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: M. Tennant

customer_reviews.title: definitely wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Successful toy at my 4 year old grandson's house, so I've added this set for Grannie's toy room. Because it was not e a s y , at first building the towers frustrated my 5 year old granddaughter. Her next visit was a few days later, and this was the first toy she wanted to try. It was her idea to try to copy the tower in the instruction booklet, and it was my idea that we do the building together. We both had a terrific time, dealing w mixed results as we went during the next hour or so, being inventive. fiddling about, and shifting the pieces and angles ever so slightly.
customer_reviews.author: alsoanonyma

customer_reviews.title: Get this one!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the brand and marble track you want! The other brands will leave you frustrated and annoyed and your kid will be disappointed that they cant make a marble run like they see in all those videos. This brand is super sturdy and doesnt fall apart. Heck, I have to yank pretty hard to get some of the peices to come apart...which is ideal when building these tracks. So go ahead - buy this one, you wont be disappointed 😁
customer_reviews.author: smileykaili

customer_reviews.title: Everything fit together nicely and worked the way it was supposed to
customer_reviews.text: This set is sturdier than I thought it would be. I was concerned that the pieces wouldn't connect well enough and that the whole design would fall apart, but that is not the case. Everything fit together nicely and worked the way it was supposed to. If I had to make one recommendation, it would be to add a little extra weight to the bases, as it is rather easy to knock it off balance. Other than that, love this set.
customer_reviews.author: ThePhantasm

customer_reviews.title: Was a hit
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my nephew who just turned 4. He liked it but the pieces are a tight fit so it was difficult for him to put them together. He's able to use the direction to put legos together but the directions with this are a little difficult to read and he needed a lot of help from adults. My 6yr old niece really liked marble maz but she also needed a lot of adult help putting it together. Great toy but not something kids can do by themself.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: 4 yr old twins love it
customer_reviews.text: My boy girl twins received this for their fourth birthday. They obviously need assistance assembling but they love the building process and creating new configurations. The best part is watching the marbles run through their design! We love it so much I immediately purchased another set and the sound attachments. I love this toy because you can see the kids using their brain and having fun while doing it. Depending on how you build your run, the structure can be a bit precarious but the pieces are solid and well built. I’ll be buying this for gifts in the future. Great toy, highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: J. M. K.

customer_reviews.title: This is the second set I've purchased
customer_reviews.text: OK. I can't remember if this is the same vendor for the first set of Marble Genius I bought through Amazon a few years ago. Each time, this was a hit for a gift. Here's what I like: 1) Plastic pieces are smooth and always connect well. 2) The parts and the structures they build are sturdy - nothing tippy or flimsy 3) Enough sections to make a wide variety of structures 4) Good selection of plans for kids to follow
customer_reviews.author: NHP

customer_reviews.title: Very much disappointed by the product!
customer_reviews.text: I got this item as gift for my son 7th birthday. This was a huge disappointment for both of us. The structure is not stable and it easily falls apart. I bought this seeing positive reviews, they all are misleading. This toy is good to keep the kid occupied but as it is not stable they will lose interest soon and become annoyed..
customer_reviews.author: GodLoves

customer_reviews.title: Just what you would expect!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is just what you would expect. Brightly colored plastic pieces that fit together easily and are almost infinitely configurable. If you build it wonky it won't be stable. If you sit or stomp on the pieces, yes they will break. A good assortment of movement pieces that spin or cause the marble to bounce, jump, fall, rattle, etc. My 3 1/2 year granddaughter loves it, giggles with glee & loves to try different arrangements. We will likely order an expansion set when she extinguishes to this.
customer_reviews.author: Doctyphoon

customer_reviews.title: The marble run was great until one of the pieces was defective
customer_reviews.text: The marble run was great until one of the pieces was defective. We couldn’t finish building it as one of the plastic pieces was bent and defective. We couldn’t get a replacement for the one piece so had to return the entire toy. We won’t be getting a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Sheri K

customer_reviews.title: 100% enjoyment, 100% fun, 100% satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I had a marble run when I was a child, and remember is SO fondly. I knew I had to get one for my son when he was old enough. It's now been weeks since Christmas, and we still play with this for hours every day. I could not be more thrilled with this item- the pieces fit together firmly, but are not hard to take apart. They are sturdy, and have a smooth satisfying feel under your hands. The spinners were all included, and work perfectly. I have already, and will continue to recommend this item to other parents.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Russo

customer_reviews.title: My Kids Love Them!
customer_reviews.text: My kids have always loved playing with marbles, but have never gotten them a marble run until now. I loved playing with mine growing up and thought they would like it too, which they do. It's a great toy cause it will entertain my boys for hours, but since my boys are 3 and 5 years old, its a little too difficult for them to build it themselves, so I have to build it every time they want to play with it. Overall, it's a great toy, but some of the tubs fit together a little loosely, which causes it to be a bit unstable.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids
customer_reviews.text: Great for kids. My two downsides is that it would be nice if it came with a bag or something to out everything in. The pieces are slightly awkward so finding a container for them took some time. The second thing would be having better instructions for how to put acertain one together. They have pictures of "structures" but they are difficult to follow. You can "free build" but my kids are a little young to do that ok their own so I like having something to follow.
customer_reviews.author: Spumonte

customer_reviews.title: A wonderful creative toy
customer_reviews.text: Here's an toy filled with open-ended play that just keeps on playing. I bought this for my grandson who is 5. He gets up early to play with it and builds the most remarkable structures. Some of them work, others not so much, but he just says "oops - next time", tears it apart and builds something else. There are lots of youtube videos out there showing the remarkable things people do. I'm impressed and pleased with this and highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Bridge

customer_reviews.title: Well Made
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my 8-year-old grandson, and he was thrilled with it. We started building right away, and I was pleased to see how sturdy the pieces were. I would like to have more plans for various arrangements--there was just the main (pretty complicated) one included. However, he was able to create a simple one with his own imagination, and I'm sure he'll come up with other ideas. We have not tried out the app which they say has more plans.
customer_reviews.author: WordWoman

customer_reviews.title: Best toy EVER!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set for my 3-year-old grandson for Christmas. It was the second gift he opened and we had to work several times to coax him away from it to open other gifts! It is now April and he continues to play with it daily. It's one of the few toys he has that is also fun for adults to play with - as an only child, he seeks out playmates with whatever adults are nearby. My daughter has since purchased additional 'add-on' packs for it to spur his (and his dad's - his favorite co-architect) creativity. This item has the potential to be a toy that's played with for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: E. Hengeveld-Bidmon

customer_reviews.title: Fun for all ages!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my 5 yr old! He loves setting up the run in different ways and we have even downloaded the marble run app that gives different types of runs to make and challenges to assemble. Anytime our nieces and nephews (Aged 4-11) come over, they all love playing with the marble run! Planning to buy another one to add to our collection.
customer_reviews.author: Hga0388

customer_reviews.title: Could have been a 5 * product...
customer_reviews.text: Its a nice product and concept too. But the pieces get separated too easily. My kid just loves it but have to be too carefull while playing. Specially the bigger sets take too much time to assemble which is ok but a pain when it breaks and you have to start over again. I hoped the pieces specially around the joins (if not all) had longer joints.
customer_reviews.author: Chi008

customer_reviews.title: Also the handbook with pictures is not very well illustrated and it's tedious to try to follow the color-coded steps
customer_reviews.text: Hmm.. I picked this one because it was the Amazon chosen one. We will be returning it because the pieces don't line up or bend to make it truly possible to connect them for an adequate marble run. I don't know why this is amazon's chosen product. Also the handbook with pictures is not very well illustrated and it's tedious to try to follow the color-coded steps.. (not very user friendly).
customer_reviews.author: forester

customer_reviews.title: Great toy, small pieces could be choking hazard
customer_reviews.text: Overall great product. We play with this during one on one hangout time with our 2.5 almost 3 year old. She loves building & dropping the marbles in. She’s very intrigued with this toy. We could easily play for hours without getting bored. (This toy is not recommended for this age, but we do it anyways with adult present. Do not let your child play with this alone because there are small pieces they could choke on easily)
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Lorien

customer_reviews.title: Very fun to play with.
customer_reviews.text: I would love.to give this 5 stars, the only thing I had an issue with was that there isnt very much support, it tips.over very easy but after playing with it, we have managed to figure out how to put it together without falling, most of the time. It's a super fun toy though, my son really enjoys playing with it as he is obsessed with marble runs. I feel like if the pieces assembled a little easier and stayed in it would make this even better. I like that it comes with a downloadable app so you can build more runs.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality with cheap plastic parts
customer_reviews.text: This is a very poor quality toy with cheap plastic parts. Very difficult for kids to assemble as the parts quality are poor and hurt your wrist to twist and turn and put together. Colors are also not bright again as it’s cheap quality plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Talia

customer_reviews.title: So when placed on a soft surface like a carpet it is slightly more prone to tipping ...
customer_reviews.text: My nephew just turned 4 and loves this! He needs a little help at times to complete the project but loves dropping the marbles and seeing what happens with the course he built.The only con that I can see is that the pieces are a little lighter than the classic set that I grew up with. So when placed on a soft surface like a carpet it is slightly more prone to tipping over and falling apart completely. However building a solid structure is part of the learning process!!
customer_reviews.author: lkjj

customer_reviews.title: the product instructions are terrible. Its like there was a stationary camera in ...
customer_reviews.text: the product instructions are terrible. Its like there was a stationary camera in the room and it couldnt move so all the photos are from 1 perspective. The product needs 25 different steps and instead it has 8. There are pieces to be assembled that are located behind pieces in the front which you cant see but still you are supposed to know how they are assembled. Yes its fun to do your own thing but get the base model done right first. Really a poor job of assembly instructions
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Attractive and stable
customer_reviews.text: This is a great set. The pieces are translucent; so it Is easy to track marbles as they descend. The pieces also hold firmly, which is a big plus. I purchased this set and add ons, which are all high quality. My only qualm is this. Instructions are primarily visual, which is difficult for someone who is legally blind. That said, it’s pretty intuitive. I recommend the set, especially as a first one because of it’s expansion and compatibility opportunities.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hours of fun if it doesn’t break
customer_reviews.text: This marble run is better than the first marble run we purchased. I am disappointed that the bases broke within a week of having the toy. I don’t think they are constructed well because they are pretty easy to break. There is a little white piece that connects the two yellow pieces and ours was snapped apart, leaving part of the white piece permanently stuck in the hole of the yellow piece, if that makes sense. The pictures might help explain.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Marbles came broken - VERY DANGEROUS
customer_reviews.text: Not sturdy at all; marbles actually came broken (about 4 of them) and were very sharp and dangerous for the kids. Absolutely unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Glass

customer_reviews.title: Grandson loved this gift
customer_reviews.text: My 9 year old grandson was very excited to get the marble genius super set. He had previously played with a small marble run set but this one has so many options for building a maze it really excited him. The morning after his birthday party he put a maze together and can't stop playing with the marble run! My daughter-in-law is also using the set as a science teaching tool while she home schools the kids this year.
customer_reviews.author: T in Cinci

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy that also engages the mind
customer_reviews.text: My four-year-old son loves to play with this toy. We gave it to him for Christmas and it is one of the toys he plays with the most. It uses normal-sized marbles and stays together quite well. It sometimes frustrates him because he has not yet learned how to make a structure sound (i.e. he makes his towers too tall). Also, he is still learning how to make the marbles go through the run the way he intends. I think this is a really good activity for him to engage in, as it makes him consider and choose his options for the desired outcomes. He is also learning patience in the process. I am glad we picked this set.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great marble toy.
customer_reviews.text: I was happily surprised this was a well made toy, the plastic is sturdy enough for my 4 and 1 year old to build and play with. They spent a couple of hours with some help from me to build a little course. The marbles are all good quality, no damaged, broken or half marbles found in the bag. All in all I would buy a 2nd one so we can make the courses higher and longer.
customer_reviews.author: Kuro570

customer_reviews.title: Not the set or brand to buy
customer_reviews.text: This set is absolutely terrible! The suggested building directions are not correct and doesn’t create a leveled working set and the pieces don’t connect correctly, which makes the set wobbly. I am very disappointed in this purchase. It was a Christmas present for my son.
customer_reviews.author: mamatnt

customer_reviews.title: For the young and old alike!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for an activity center for my first grade class. They loved it and were experimenting with motion and creative engineering. (Fun - science technology engineering and math) Timinh different results from different structures. Amazing learning tool. Last weekend, I took the marble magic activities to the memory care center where my mom resides. The seniors loved it as much as my first graders. Well designed, educational fun!
customer_reviews.author: Dot A

customer_reviews.title: Fun with a caveat
customer_reviews.text: Lots of fun for parents and kids alike. However, my 3 year old has a difficult time adding on pieces the higher it gets. He doesn't understand yet how to stabilize it and he sometimes gets frustrated when the thing comes crashing down as do we the parents. He'll just have to learn over time. That being said, would have been nicer to have more bases in this set.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun, could use a little better pictures in the instructions
customer_reviews.text: The marble run is a great toy - lots of opportunity to change it up and play around with the ways the marbles will run through the maze. Unfortunately, if you want to build the run exactly as it is pictured in the instructions, it can be a little tough because the angles of the photographs in the instructions does not show all aspects of the run clearly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very enjoyable
customer_reviews.text: Your child will love it! Some of the pieces are tighter than others, while some are looser. But they still stay in place. A few times the tower tilted, but we also used more than one marble at a time. There are tons of pieces which is great to make a huge tower! There is instructions on making the tower on the box as well. I love that there are tons of marbles given too. Marbles get lost, roll under the couch, but we will be good for a while with all of these marbles!
customer_reviews.author: Felicia

customer_reviews.title: A toy young kids and adults can enjoy together
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing toy. I spent hours playing with it with my 6 and 3 year old granddaughters. I enjoyed it as much as they did. While I was reading the instructions and trying to pick a figure to assemble, they started putting it together. My help consisted mostly in trying to maintain stability. They were very creative in finding ways to use the pieces. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Seaford

customer_reviews.title: Unstable, flimsy, falls apart.
customer_reviews.text: This product is really flimsy and unstable. We have done everything we can do keep it together and it keeps tripping and falling apart. We have taped it together at each joint and has not helped at all. My kids are having a blast playing with it when it's together for a minute before it falls down again and breaks. It's a fun product but it's unstable. Really unstable!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What a fun toy set!
customer_reviews.text: This exceeded our expectations. My four year old daughter loves it, actually the whole family love it, dad included! So many possibilities of setting this up. Good sturdy design. Love it...
customer_reviews.author: Aswathy Sebastian

customer_reviews.title: This is saving our sanity!
customer_reviews.text: We are stuck home with a 2 1/2 year old. With daycare closed we have been hard pressed to find ways to entertain him. This set has been amazing. He loves helping to put it together and then watching the marbles go down. The pieces seem sturdy and have taken quite a bit of abuse. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Vestryanna

customer_reviews.title: " I read about several different ones and I chose this one because it was described as pretty sturdy and doesn't break easily
customer_reviews.text: My 3-year old grandson LOVES his marble track. When his Mom asked him what he wanted for Christmas, he said "A marble run!" Then she asked him what they should get Daddy for Christmas. He said, "I know, a marble run!" I read about several different ones and I chose this one because it was described as pretty sturdy and doesn't break easily, and because it didn't have so many pieces to overwhelm a 3-year old. I remember getting one for my kids and how much they loved playing with it. Very happy with this one.
customer_reviews.author: French Canadian

customer_reviews.title: but the instructions suck! By instructions I was not able to built ...
customer_reviews.text: The maze over all is ok, but the instructions suck! By instructions I was not able to built it, I built it by the picture on the box. And you have to built it where you're planning to use it, you cannot take it from one place to another because it will crash down. My daughter touched it and the top fell on the floor because it has heavier stuff at the top. You can super glue it and have it permanent, but I like to switch toys around and therefore cannot glue it. But over all it's a fun project for adults or older kids.
customer_reviews.author: Aleksey Panasyuk

customer_reviews.title: My 9 Year Old Son Loves It
customer_reviews.text: Someone left a couple marbles at our house. My sons started building courses and tracks for the marbles with anything he could find around the house. Much of what he used, we needed elsewhere. He was quite creative; so I looked for a set such as this one. Huge hit! Some pieces are hard to put together and take apart.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. B.

customer_reviews.title: My two and three year old love this marble tower
customer_reviews.text: My two and three year old love this marble tower. My only complaint is that it topples over fairly easy - my boys are still young though so they just don't understand the concept yet of being careful around toys like this. I like that the tubes are see through so you can watch the marbles roll down. Also there are some fun pieces like flat funnels, stair steps and turn arounds.
customer_reviews.author: snlassen

customer_reviews.title: Supports creativity and problem solving skills
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old nephew was excited to receive the marble track and wanted someone to help him set it up. Unfortunately, everyone was busy at that time and he had to wait a while. During that time, he created a set-up that had 3 entry portals for the marbles and at least one exit shaft. He was very proud of himself. Good toy to support creativity and problem solving skills. Also helps children learn independence and perseverance!
customer_reviews.author: ltphillnm

customer_reviews.title: Holy smoke we love this thing
customer_reviews.text: Holy smoke we love this thing! We got it for my youngest’s 3rd birthday and he has played with it every day since. He must have said “this is so fun” 100 times on his birthday. He needs me to put it together for him when he smashes it to the ground, but that’s just part of the fun. Great colorful toy, that goes together in as many combinations as your imagination will allow.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Evens

customer_reviews.title: Wondewrful gift for a 6 yr old
customer_reviews.text: Gave this as a xmas present to a 6 yr old. She LOVED it more than any other toy she was gifted, she played with it for hours each day. Her dad also loved to play with it -- he normally doesnt play "kid toys" with her, but this involved building elaborate structures so he sat with her for hours building stuff. Neat to see this. Definitely recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: kitkat

customer_reviews.title: Fun at any age
customer_reviews.text: My ten-year-old saw these marble sets and really wanted one for Christmas. We had a marble set before, but it was so techy that you could only set it up one way. I went ahead and bought these, despite being worried he'd get tired of it really fast, but he still likes it. He just wishes he could get all the pieces to fit back into the box.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Buy this!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best money I have ever spent on a toy! My 4 and 6 year old love this! They spent the first three days we had it building different runs. The pieces fit together nicely. We built it on carpet and had no issues. I also love that I can see their brains working and growing as they play with this!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Low quality manufacturing
customer_reviews.text: Once assembled according to instructions, the tower was uneven and kept falling over. We had to prop it up with a book. This is very embarrassing since it was a gift.
customer_reviews.author: StayGolden3000

customer_reviews.title: Stable enough
customer_reviews.text: Like the other reviewers said, it's not the most stable but some parts fit tightly while others are bit loose but still okay. I need to help my 4 yr old (he just turned 4), but he loves it. Was worried it was way too wobbly or won't fit but that's not the case. With parent's help it works great.
customer_reviews.author: eid8801

customer_reviews.title: Great stem activity
customer_reviews.text: Love this toy. It’s so great for STEM for kids from 4-10+. It encourages them to create different tracks and problem solve. I use it with my son who is 5 as well. I also have fun playing with them and making new designs with him. It’s also my go to gift for Christmas for friends and relatives.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra Policastro

customer_reviews.title: just a picture of what it is supposed to look like. Not a big deal
customer_reviews.text: My 4yr loves it. But he gets frustrated by the lack of stability. Some of the pieces do not stick together tightly and causes it to fall apart. Also there is zero instructions with it, just a picture of what it is supposed to look like. Not a big deal, I got it together but for a child it could be difficult. There is no need to do what the picture shows, my son has been using his imagination and has endless fun
customer_reviews.author: aceman

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for kids!
customer_reviews.text: This marble run set has been really fun. There are so many different combinations and my 7, 5, and 3 year olds have loved it. I didn't find the app that came with it very useful, my kids have more fun just building their own. PLENTY of marbles come with this kit as well.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie V.

customer_reviews.title: Out-of-the-box, ready for fun
customer_reviews.text: The very best toy we have purchased in a while. My 5-year old was able to play with it right out of the box and our 2-year old was able to join the fun with some coaching. They have been playing together with it for two hours straight and show no signs of stopping. The pieces are very well made, and fit together well. The plastic is see-through which adds to the fun of seeing the marbles run through. Lots of possible configurations, no instructions needed. Parent participation is for fun only-- not necessary as the kids can easily build independently.
customer_reviews.author: MnMom

customer_reviews.title: Fun and Creative. I recommend.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second set of these we have ordered for our son. It's great! Love how you can see the marbles roll through. (The parts are translucent). The parts are pretty sturdy too - not a lot of breakage after heavy use. The one ding I would give it, is the instructions to assemble the structure featured on the box are hard to follow, but its not the end of the world. You can easily create your own design which is more fun and creative anyway.
customer_reviews.author: H. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a motivational toy for my kid learning to read - one piece awarded for each lesson he completes. My kid is very rough on toys, but this is holding up well. The pieces fit together snuggly, they balance well, the marbles do not get stuck in the run and it's fun to see through the pieces. This has been a big hit with everyone in the family who encourage the little one to read more so they can all play with new pieces.
customer_reviews.author: RD

customer_reviews.title: Very fun creative toy
customer_reviews.text: We have not had any quality problems with this kit. It is plastic, but a good quality that can stand up to play. If stepped on wrong they could crack, but otherwise seems reliably sturdy. The designs may need help from an adult for kids that get frustrated with a challenge or need help balancing a piece.
customer_reviews.author: Wholehealthcaboodle

customer_reviews.title: My wife and I love it more than our 4 year old does
customer_reviews.text: It became very clear that my wife and I were having more fun playing with this than our 4 year old and she loves it too.
customer_reviews.author: TheRiot!!!

customer_reviews.title: ok for older kids
customer_reviews.text: Really pretty disappointed. It’s a great idea, but no way can you put this together with a six-year-old. It’s easy enough for adults to put together, but not with kids “help”. We had to wait until her six-year-old grandson was gone to get it assembled. And it was fairly rickety. Maybe just better for older kids?
customer_reviews.author: Kelli

customer_reviews.title: Creative, Fun, Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: Got this for our 4 year old, but turns out we like playing with it just as much. The product is pretty stable and sturdy for the price - just don't forget to add the stabilizer pegs to the 2-part U-shaped stands. Expect a little wobble with the taller builds, but still fun. The quality is what we expected, and it does what we want it to. The app has instructions and is an added bonus for ideas on creative structures.
customer_reviews.author: The Sledges

customer_reviews.title: The Grandson loves his marble maze
customer_reviews.text: He's only 3 so I help him build the mazes but he will play for days on a set up. He loves watching them go down.
customer_reviews.author: LMT

customer_reviews.title: A great toy for all ages!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really neat toy that has provided literally hours and hours of enjoyment for my 4-year old nephew (and me!). The pieces fit well together, it is very sturdy and stands up well even on carpet. There are an infinite number of ways to build these runs, and this toy never gets boring. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: Nice toy
customer_reviews.text: This arrived yesterday. The product is a decent quality our 5 year old loves it and can (sort of) build tracks. We will have to order more pieces. There are not enough straight pieces to support the more interesting pieces making it unstable and more likely to fall especially when King Kong (2 year old) comes around to play. Overall, good toy that has captured the attention of very active 5 year old for hours! You will probably need additional marbles also.
customer_reviews.author: The griswold's

customer_reviews.title: My students LOVED it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I used this to help teach NGSS standards with force and motion. I also used it as a class management tool when I first set it up. I would pick the best table or students during a lesson, then they were able to go and roll the marbles down the tracks. Very motivating!!
customer_reviews.author: Becky Monroe

customer_reviews.title: Engineer dad even loves it
customer_reviews.text: My boys ages 4&6 Love this. We don't always keep it out but it's fun to take apart and put a whole new course together. Dad's an engineer so he's loving it too :) when kids come over to play it's a big hit!
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Lots of options
customer_reviews.text: There are so many pieces and marbles that my kids can split the pieces and make two separate runs if they wish. My kids have caused the runs to crash and fall multiple times while playing, yet the pieces are no worse for wear. Great product and great fun!
customer_reviews.author: Jewelwoodz18

customer_reviews.title: The marble run is awesome, and it fits together great
customer_reviews.text: Gave my son this for his 3rd birthday, and I've played with it every day since. The marble run is awesome, and it fits together great. We bought extra marbles and can get like 200 marbles going at once. It's entrancing. But then my toddler is all like, "Mom, I want to play" and ends up knocking it over and wrecking the whole thing. Seriously, he's not old enough to put it together himself yet, but he loves playing with it once I do. Great for all ages, just be cautious of the choking hazards of the marbles.
customer_reviews.author: Karyn E

customer_reviews.title: Entertain for Hours
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 7 year old brother and its one of the few toys (other than electronics) that keeps his interest for longer than 10 minutes. I think it could stand to be a little sturdier but overall its nice and worth the price. Definitely a toy your child will have to play with in a separate room than you because it gets noisy!
customer_reviews.author: Alexis W

customer_reviews.title: Interesting toy but instruction not so good
customer_reviews.text: For our grandson. Interesting toy and fun. The one negative is that the instructions are basically ... copy what is shown in the picture. These pictures are not very detailed and only from one view point. Given that this toy is 3-deminsional it was really hard to figure the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Tons of fun!
customer_reviews.text: 5 year old is thrilled, along with her dad........and uncles......all engineers hoping to inspire another. You can get really creative and her current marbles from "Moon Marble" fit the track. Hours of fun and creativity. Sturdy product too, really impressed with it. Will be ordering additional pieces
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: We play with this more than our kid!
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrific toy! Buy it now!! My husband and I love setting it up and seeing how we can use every single piece. Great hands-on toy that sharpens your engineering skills too.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Fun little project toy.
customer_reviews.text: Great little marble run. Can be tedious to build and requires some patience, but it's fun to watch when a project is complete. Was able to build every example in the directions, but you do have to use your brain constructing sets. It's a delicate toy. Our toddler knocks it down very easily. So I just rebuild a new construction idea everytime for him to play with.
customer_reviews.author: J.P.

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with other brands of Marble Run
customer_reviews.text: Another user asked if it was compatible with the Meland Marble Run brand, and they were told yes. FALSE! False! False! Definitely not compatible. I’m very disappointed because now how am I supposed to sort it all back out to return it? What a headache that would be. This brand is sturdier than Meland and seems better made, except one piece broke the first day we had it open. Otherwise, I like it. I just wish I had all the same brand so everything would fit nicely together.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Mahoney

customer_reviews.title: Fun for the whole family!
customer_reviews.text: Great toy, very entertaining! My 7 year has tons of fun with it on his own and was able to follow the app. I make very simple structures for my 2.5 year old and she loves it. Hubby has lots of fun as well. Great family activity, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: hl1000

customer_reviews.title: Super fun
customer_reviews.text: My five year old loves this and though he can't build it on his own he does a great job directing us. We have more fun putting it together and testing it then actually playing. There is enough here that we don't need an extension pack.
customer_reviews.author: Josie

customer_reviews.title: My two granddaughters were delighted with this product!
customer_reviews.text: This was intended as a somewhat "outside the box" holiday gift to my granddaughters, aged 3 and 5. They (Zoe and Zelda) are pretty bright and we wanted to challenge them with an open-ended project. The next morning they sent me a photo of the entire box of tubes and other pieces integrated into a single puzzle, and they were having races between marbles on different paths. This looks like it will have a long and entertaining lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Westbrook

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!!!
customer_reviews.text: Likes: - Great value - Our 3 1/2 yr old daughter LOVES this set - Lots of combinations - A free app/community with lots of ideas and user designs/pictures - Well made Dislikes: - That we didn’t buy more for the three of us!
customer_reviews.author: MASH Polson

customer_reviews.title: WORST QUALITY EVER!!!!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT PURCHASE! Horrible HORRIBLE quality! It took 2 hours + to build . Extremely frustrating and not fun at all for my child when it’s not sturdy , keeps falling over, it easy to reassemble , no stability. If i could give this no stars i would. It’s a cheap POS . I’d rather spend more money and buy a better quality one. This one also car dirty as if it’s been used and re sold. Don’t buy! I have to purchase a better one now. Waste of Money and time.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Salazar-Navarro

customer_reviews.title: Fun for everyone
customer_reviews.text: Overall very satisfied. Made my daughter super happy and kept her attention for a few weeks. She is 3 so that's pretty good. Quality is a 7/10, a little flimsy, and doesn't always like to stay connected. But for the price, I can't complain. Very happy with it in the end.
customer_reviews.author: whitejd

customer_reviews.title: easy to build
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of pieces, easy to build, good quality! My kids have enjoyed these a lot! It’s something we can all do together or can keep them entertained when I need to get things done! My kids are 4 1/2 and just 3, and they love it!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Williamson

customer_reviews.title: More fun than Q-Ba-Maze
customer_reviews.text: We bought my son Marble Genius for Christmas with the booster set in the sound effects add on pack, and we got my daughter the Q-Ba-Maze 2.0 with the stunts, and they like this more than they like hers. Q-Ba-Maze is a little bit more difficult to play with and not as fun IMO
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Rainy Day Lifesaver!
customer_reviews.text: Super hit! So glad I purchased this. We had rain for three days straight, and the grandkids (2, 4, & 7) couldn't go outside. This was the perfect solution. We, yes we, played for hours and hours each day! So much fun and creativity!
customer_reviews.author: Evie

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: I love that this track set is easy enough for my 4 year old but still very sturdy and you can use regular marbles too! This set does cost a little more than the others I think it's totally worth it! My kids play with it almost non-stop and I see it lasting a good long while!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Tons of fun!
customer_reviews.text: Tons of fun for the kids. It's great when a toy can keep my kids away from electronic devices. They play marble run for long stretches of time. I got lots of marble from a dollar store so they run a steady flow of marbles through the their structures. They love it!
customer_reviews.author: Brooklyn Mama

customer_reviews.title: It’s fun but difficult for kids to set it up
customer_reviews.text: My four old grand daughter had fun with this item However, her mom had to put it together It is suggested that the parts be numbered to help young children set it up following simply presented picture “maps”
customer_reviews.author: CANDID WIT

customer_reviews.title: He was really happy with it
customer_reviews.text: I am totally please with the Marble Run purchase I made. I bought this for my grandson who just turned 3 years old. He was really happy with it. His older brother, 5 years old, also loves to build the different runs and play. AND their father helps them build new runs and joins in on the fun. I would highly recommend this for kids who like construction and making different routes/roads to watch the marbles run and for parents and grandparents who enjoy in participating in cool activites with the kids.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality marble run set.
customer_reviews.text: Great marble run set. My four year old is building amazing marble runs with this stuff... I taught him how it all works and now he runs with it. Recommended. I almost took off a star because the pictures in the instructions aren't drawn well in parts, but I figured out how to just look at the parts and use my own judgment and it worked out great, it's not rocket science.
customer_reviews.author: Rod

product_meta.title: Marble Genius Marble Run Super Set - 150 Complete Pieces + Free Instruction App (85 Translucent Marbulous Pieces + 65 Glass Marbles)
feature_bullets: 85 complete see-through Marble Run pieces in 19 distinct styles allow you to see all the action (we don't count pieces like everyone else - these are actual complete pieces and not parts that have to be added together! See comparison in Product Description.)
Solid plastic pieces that stick together and are easy for kids to play with
8 solid bases including 3 large bases to ensure maximum stability (large base designs vary slightly per included pieces image)
Free Marble Genius Instruction App with purchase that includes 9 step-by-step guides, fun challenges, and regularly updated content (iOS or Android)

Compatible with Marbulous Marble Run Toys including our Marble Genius Marble Run Starter Set (60 pc.), Extreme Set (125 pc.), Booster Set (20 pc.), & 9 Accessory Sets. Standard Toy Size Marbles (5/8 inch or smaller) work with this set (65 Glass Marbles Included)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars2,093 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
